data.description: // Variables for CSB determined properties var jobAlertLinkLabelTextFontColor = ""; var jobAlertLinkLabelTextHoverColor = ""; document.getElementById("aria-pageTitleText-hidden").innerText = "IC Development (Software) - Summer Intern (May '26 - Aug '26)"; Search Jobs //<![CDATA[ window.savedFilter = "null"; var isBrandedHostName = "false"; //String isBrandedHostName is being used as multiple other places, so creating a new boolean variable to handle job search href. var isBrandedHostNameBool = "false" === "true"; function navToSearchResults() { var brand = ""; var isBrandFormEnabled = "false" === "true"; if(j2w.SearchManager && j2w.SearchManager.search){ j2w.SearchResultsUnify.removeResultContent(); j2w.SearchManager.search(null); } else{ var sQueryParm = ""; $(".well-small.searchwell input:visible").each(function(index,item) { sQueryParm += encodeURIComponent(item.name) + "=" + encodeURIComponent(item.value) + "&" }); if (isBrandedHostNameBool) { window.location.href = '/search/?'+ sQueryParm; } else { window.location.href = (brand && isBrandFormEnabled ? '/' + brand : '') + '/search/?'+ sQueryParm; } } } (function(){ var oSearchInputs = $('.searchwell .input-group > input'); var submitButton = $('.searchwell .keywordsearchbutton:visible'); oSearchInputs.on('keyup', function (e) { if(e?.key?.toLowerCase() === 'enter') { submitButton.trigger('click'); } }); })() //]]> Job Description .buttontext24095abbacc6c537 a{ border: 1px solid transparent; } .buttontext24095abbacc6c537 a:focus{ border: 1px dashed #3070a6 !important; outline: none !important; } #body.unify div.unify-button-container .unify-apply-now:focus, #body.unify div.unify-button-container .unify-apply-now:hover{color:rgb(255,255,255) !important;}#body.unify div.unify-button-container .unify-apply-now:focus, #body.unify div.unify-button-container .unify-apply-now:hover{background:rgba(17,61,115,1.0) !important;} Apply now .buttontext64844663f7da10cc a{ border: 1px solid transparent; } .buttontext64844663f7da10cc a:focus{ border: 1px dashed #3070a6 !important; outline: none !important; } Job Title: IC Development (Software) - Summer Intern (May '26 - Aug '26) Posting Start Date: 8/19/25 Job Location(s): Austin If you are looking for a challenging and exciting career in the world of technology, then look no further. Skyworks is an innovator of high-performance analog semiconductors whose solutions are powering the wireless networking revolution. Through our broad technology expertise and one of the most extensive product portfolios in the industry, we are Connecting Everyone and Everything, All the Time. At Skyworks, you will find a fast-paced environment with a strong focus on global collaboration, minimal layers of management, and the freedom to make meaningful contributions in a setting that encourages creative thinking. We are excited about the opportunity to work with you and glad you want to be part of a team of talented individuals who together are changing the way the world communicates. Requisition ID: 75987 Job Description: Job Description The Timing Business R&D team within the MSS division is at the forefront of developing cutting-edge technologies that power wired and wireless connectivity around the world. The IC Development Software team is seeking a talented Summer Intern for 2026, ideally pursuing a degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or Electrical Engineering with a strong interest in software development. Our projects span a wide range of areas, including new product development, desktop and firmware application development, command-line interface (CLI) tools, API development to control IC devices and instruments, and database integration. Term: Summer Intern (May '26 to August '26) Responsibilities As a Software Engineering Intern, you will be involved in the full development cycle and contribute to the following: Developing new applications and supporting existing ones using best coding practices. Working independently on a personal project. Meeting daily with your mentor to learn and receive guidance. Collaborating with other team members. Solving key mixed-signal challenges through software solutions. Presenting periodic project updates and receiving feedback from leadership. Required Experience and Skills We hope youâ€™ll enjoy learning about our timing technology, company culture, and networking with professionals across the organization. This internship is a great opportunity for anyone interested in rigorous training in software development within the semiconductor industry. Our ideal candidate is an undergraduate or graduate student majoring in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or Electrical Engineering, with the following qualifications: Strong understanding of object-oriented programming. Proficiency in at least one high-level language: C#, Python, C/C++, or Java. Experience with version control systems such as Git or SVN. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Additional Preferred Skills Experience with SQL or NoSQL databases. Familiarity with low-level firmware programming. Background in Electrical Engineering, particularly digital logic. #LI-DJ1 The typical pay range for an Engineering intern across the U.S. is currently USD $26.00 - $47.50 per hour and for a Non-Engineering intern across the U.S. is currently USD $22.50 - $42.00 per hour. Starting pay will depend on level of education, the ultimate job duties and requirements, and work location. Skyworks has different pay ranges for different work locations in the U.S. Skyworks is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Skyworks strives to create an accessible workplace; if you need an accommodation due to a disability, please contact us at accommodations@skyworksinc.com. #body.unify div.unify-button-container .unify-apply-now:focus, #body.unify div.unify-button-container .unify-apply-now:hover{color:rgb(255,255,255) !important;}#body.unify div.unify-button-container .unify-apply-now:focus, #body.unify div.unify-button-container .unify-apply-now:hover{background:rgba(17,61,115,1.0) !important;} Apply now if("043a9d1194153e8e" === "7e37b59f" && "#630E8E") { jobAlertLinkLabelTextFontColor = "#630E8E";
